seo.description: diBoaS connects you to established decentralized finance protocols. See exactly where your money goes with full transparency.
seo.ogTitle: Where Your Money Works | The Protocols We Trust
seo.ogDescription: See exactly which DeFi protocols diBoaS uses and why we trust them. Full transparency about where your money works.

intro.paragraph1: We believe you should know exactly where your money works. Unlike traditional banks that hide what they do with your deposits, we show you everything.
intro.paragraph2: Every protocol listed here has been researched, tested, and approved by our team. We look at security audits, track record, and how long they've been operating. If we wouldn't put our own money there, we won't put yours there either.
intro.disclaimer: Being on this list doesn't mean zero risk. It means we've done our homework and trust these protocols enough to include them in our strategies.

lending.title: Lending Protocols
lending.description: These protocols let people lend and borrow crypto. You earn yield by providing liquidity that others borrow.

staking.title: Staking Protocols
staking.description: These protocols let you earn rewards by helping secure blockchain networks.

stablecoins.title: Stablecoins & Synthetic Assets
stablecoins.description: These protocols create stable assets pegged to real-world values like the US dollar.

yield.title: Yield & Trading Protocols
yield.description: These protocols generate yield through trading fees, yield optimization, or structured products.

perpetuals.title: Perpetual & Trading Exchanges
perpetuals.description: These protocols let traders bet on price movements. You earn yield by providing the liquidity they trade against.

dex.title: Decentralized Exchanges (DEX)
dex.description: These protocols let you swap tokens without a centralized exchange.

rwa.title: Payment & RWA Infrastructure
rwa.description: These protocols bridge traditional finance and crypto.

selectionProcess.intro: We don't add protocols randomly. Every protocol here passed our checklist:

criteria.operation: At least 1 year of operation (with few exceptions for exceptional protocols)
criteria.audits: Professional security audits from recognized firms
criteria.exploits: No unresolved exploits where user funds were lost and not recovered
criteria.transparent: Transparent operations — we can verify how the protocol works
criteria.usage: Real usage — actual users, not just hype

selectionProcess.note: When protocols have had security incidents, we note them clearly. Transparency works both ways.

totalTvl.paragraph1: The protocols we work with collectively secure over
totalTvl.note: This doesn't mean your money is in all of them. Each diBoaS strategy uses specific protocols suited to its risk level and goals.

q1.question: Why don't you list every DeFi protocol?
q1.answer: We're selective. Most DeFi protocols don't meet our standards.

q2.question: How often do you update this list?
q2.answer: We continuously monitor all protocols. If something changes, we'll add or remove as needed.

q3.question: Can I request a protocol to be added?
q3.answer: Yes. Contact us at hello@diboas.com with your suggestion.

footer.sources: Data sources: DeFiLlama, official protocol documentation, security audit reports
